definition: to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
to trip/to miss a step/to slip

sentences.english: He reeled back when the heavy blow landed on his head.
sentences.chinese: 他的头受此重重一击，使他向后打了个趔趄。

sentences.english: The drunkard staggered along the street.
sentences.chinese: 那醉汉趔趄着走在街上。

sentences.english: Suddenly, he started back at the report of fire-arms .
sentences.chinese: 忽然，枪声起处，他朝后打了个趔趄。

sentences.english: Eventually he pushed her off, and she stumbled towards the winepress.
sentences.chinese: 最后，他把她推开，她一个趔趄，倒向了那台榨酒机。

sentences.english: The sudden jolt plunged her forward.
sentences.chinese: 突然颠了一下，她向前打了一个趔趄。

sentences.english: He ran wildly, pressing his hands against a bloody wound in his stomach.
sentences.chinese: 他趔趄地跑着，双手按着腹部的伤口。

sentences.english: His foot caught in a rock and he pitched forward.
sentences.chinese: 他的脚拌在石头上，他向前趔趄了几步。

sentences.english: The arm namely made one exertion a to pull, a Lie Ju pours aboard explicit Mei.
sentences.chinese: 胳膊被人用力一拉，一个趔趄倒在明寐身上。

sentences.english: The old man stumbled near the archway.
sentences.chinese: 老人在拱形楼附近趔趄了一下。

definition: to fall flat on one's face
to fall flat on one's face (vulgar)
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
